author: Sophie Curtis
title: Moto 360 'Sport' smartwatch unveiled at IFA tech show
text:
Moto 360 'Sport' smartwatch unveiled at IFA tech show Lenovo has unveiled new models of its popular Android Wear-based Apple Watch rival, the Moto 360 Moto 360 Sport By Sophie Curtis , in Berlin 6:00AM BST 03 Sep 2015 Comments 
Motorola has unveiled its new Moto 360 smartwatch collection at the IFA technology show in Berlin , including a Sport version for fitness enthusiasts with built-in GPS and a heart rate sensor. 
The original Moto 360 , released in 2014, was among the first to acknowledge the importance of fashion, with a circular face and simple, stylish design. It was quickly joined by the LG Watch Urbane , Huawei Watch and, most recently, the Samsung Gear S2 . 
The new Moto 360 models take inspiration from the traditional watch world, featuring lugs specifically tailored for men and women and polished bezels in new styles, as well as customisable colours, materials and straps via the Moto Maker design studio. 
They also offer up to two full days of battery life and all-round better specs than their predecessor, while continuing to run the Android Wear operating system, which is now compatible with Apple's iPhones . 
The new Moto 360 smartwatches are dust and water resistant, and allow users to get notifications and important information from their phones delivered to their wrists, as well as respond to messages using voice commands. 
They can also carry out actions like starting the car, unlocking the front door, hailing a cab or showing a boarding pass at an airport with apps like MyFord, Kevo, Lyft and Delta. 
The Moto 360 is WiFi-enabled, keeping users connected even if their phone is out of Bluetooth range, and features Live Dials, which offer shortcuts to their favourite apps directly from the watch face. 
It can also track your heart rate and the calories you burn, and translate that information into feedback and coaching to help you improve and stay fit. 
The original Moto 360 was 2014's best-selling Android Wear device, according to research firm Canalys. However, more recent data from IDC indicates that the Apple Watch has sold in much larger numbers. 
Motorola, which is now owned by Lenovo , did not make its top five list of wearable tech manufacturers for either of the first two quarters of 2015, but it will be hoping to reverse this trajectory with the new Moto 360 models. 
The new Moto 360 will launch in various countries across North America, Latin America, Europe and Asia, priced between $300 (£196) and $430 (£281), with the Moto 360 Sport to follow soon after. UK pricing has not yet been announced.
